title: [BUG] Bidirectional sync creates duplicate issues - Huly issues not visible in Beads

comments.author: root
comments.text:

Already Existed

Sync isn't maintaining proper cross-references between systems 4. **Timing issue** - Beads tasks created before Huly sync completed ## Expected Behavior - Issues created in Huly should appear in Beads via huly-vibe-sync-011s [P1] [task] open - Huly Issue: HVSYN-48

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Huly Issue: HVSYN-48

title: Add parent-child sync tests

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Comprehensive test coverage for parent-child sync.

## Test Scenarios

1. Huly parent with sub-issues → Vibe
2. Vibe parent with children → Huly
3. Adding child to existing parent
4. Removing child from parent
5. Deleting parent (what happens to children?)
6. Re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
7. Circular reference prevention
8. Deep nesting (grandchildren)

## Deliverables

- Unit tests for parent-child mapping functions
- Integration tests for sync scenarios

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

---

- Integration tests for sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-217

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-220

title: Add parent-child sync tests

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Comprehensive test coverage for parent-child sync.

## Test Scenarios

1. Huly parent with sub-issues → Vibe
2. Vibe parent with children → Huly
3. Adding child to existing parent
4. Removing child from parent
5. Deleting parent (what happens to children?)
6. Re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
7. Circular reference prevention
8. Deep nesting (grandchildren)

## Deliverables

- Unit tests for parent-child mapping functions
- Integration tests for sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-219

title: Implement status metadata storage in Huly→Beads sync (Phase 3a)
[Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-193

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Huly Issue: HVSYN-197

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

---

title: [BUG] Bidirectional sync creates duplicate issues - Huly issues not visible in Beads
description:
## Problem

When syncing bidirectionally between Beads and Huly, duplicate issues are being created. This indicates that Huly→Beads sync is failing to import existing issues, causing Beads to create new entries for work that already exists in Huly.

## Evidence (from GRAPH project)

| Beads Created | Already Existed | Title | Status |
|---------------|-----------------|-------|--------|
| GRAPH-132 | GRAPH-101 | [P2] Update mutation paths to set updated_at | Done |
| GRAPH-134 | GRAPH-104 | [P2] Update DeltaTracker to use timestamps | Done |
| GRAPH-135 | GRAPH-102 | [P2] Add FalkorDB index on updated_at | Done |
| GRAPH-136 | GRAPH-100 | [P2] Create migration script for existing nodes | Done |
| GRAPH-131 | GRAPH-103 | [P2] Implement incremental fetch in visualizer | Done |
| GRAPH-129 | GRAPH-106 | [P3] Implement Redis Stream consumer in visualizer | Done |
| GRAPH-130 | GRAPH-105 | [P3] Create ChangeEventPublisher class | Done |
| GRAPH-128 | GRAPH-107 | [P3] Integrate publisher into Graphiti mutation paths | Done |

## Root Cause Analysis

Possible causes:
1. Huly→Beads sync failure - Original issues never made it to Beads
2. Beads deduplication failure - Beads received Huly issues but didn't recognize them
3. ID/linking mismatch - Sync not maintaining proper cross-references
4. Timing issue - Beads tasks created before Huly sync completed

## Expected Behavior

- Issues created in Huly should appear in Beads via bd list
- When Beads syncs to Huly, it should check for existing issues
- No duplicate issues should be created

## Suggested Fix

1. Investigate Huly→Beads sync to ensure issues are imported correctly
2. Add deduplication check before creating new Huly issues from Beads
3. Compare issue titles/descriptions to find potential matches
4. If match found (especially if Done), link instead of create new

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

---

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Huly Issue: HVSYN-49

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-192

title: Fix Beads sync duplicate issue creation
Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

---

Huly Issue: HVSYN-44

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Huly Issue: HVSYN-116

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

---

[Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-192

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-191

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Huly Issue: HVSYN-219

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Huly Issue: HVSYN-221

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries

- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

[Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-44

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

---

Huly Issue: HVSYN-8

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Huly Issue: HVSYN-221

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-195

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Implement reparenting detection and sync
Fix Beads sync failures across multiple projects

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Problem

Multiple projects experiencing Beads sync failures during bidirectional sync.

## Current Status

- ✅ 77 projects have Beads initialized
- ✅ Auto-initialization working
- ⚠️ Many projects failing bd sync command
- ⚠️ Database out of sync with JSONL errors

## Failing Projects

- MEILI, VIBEK, HVSYN, OCOAI - bd sync command failures
- MMCPS - Git push failures
- HDMCP - Beads init failure (not a git repo?)

## Root Causes

1. Database sync issues - stale/corrupt Beads databases
2. Git state issues - dirty working trees, merge conflicts
3. Missing git repos - some paths may not be valid repositories
4. Permission issues with WAL files

## Solution Needed

1. Run cleanup script: bd sync --import-only on all projects
2. Identify non-git repos that should skip Beads
3. Add better error handling for failed syncs
4. Add monitoring/alerting for sync failures
5. Consider retry logic with exponential backoff

## Impact

- Beads ↔ Huly sync not working reliably
- Issues created in Beads may not reach Huly
- Issues created in Huly may not reach Beads
- Git commits not being made for Beads changes

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

- Unit tests for parent-child mapping functions
- Integration tests for sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-44

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-197

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-48

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: [Epic] Enhanced Beads Status Sync via Metadata

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement full status synchronization between Huly/Vibe and Beads by storing the complete status in Beads metadata/tags, overcoming Beads' native 2-state (open/closed) limitation.

## Problem Statement

Beads only supports two native statuses:

-  - Issue is active
-  - Issue is complete

But Huly/Vibe have richer status models:

- Backlog, Todo, In Progress, In Review, Done, Canceled

Currently, when syncing Beads→Huly:

-  →  (loses granularity)
-  → 

This means status changes like "In Progress" → "In Review" made in Huly are lost when syncing back from Beads.

## Proposed Solution

Store the full Huly/Vibe status as Beads metadata or tags:

1. When syncing Huly→Beads, store  in Beads metadata
2. When syncing Beads→Huly, read the metadata to get the actual status
3. If metadata is missing, fall back to current behavior (open→Backlog, closed→Done)

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Status changes in Huly preserve full status when round-tripping through Beads
- [ ] Status changes made directly in Beads (via CLI) sync correctly to Huly
- [ ] Backward compatible with existing Beads issues (no metadata)
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover metadata-based status sync

## Objective

Comprehensive test coverage for parent-child sync.

## Test Scenarios

1. Huly parent with sub-issues → Vibe
2. Vibe parent with children → Huly
3. Adding child to existing parent
4. Removing child from parent
5. Deleting parent (what happens to children?)
6. Re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
7. Circular reference prevention
8. Deep nesting (grandchildren)

## Deliverables

- Unit tests for parent-child mapping functions
- Integration tests for sync scenarios

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

[Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

---

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

[Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios
