Huly Issue: HVSYN-197

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Fix Beads sync duplicate issue creation
Fix Beads sync duplicate issue creation
Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

title: Add parent-child sync tests

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Comprehensive test coverage for parent-child sync.

## Test Scenarios

1. Huly parent with sub-issues → Vibe
2. Vibe parent with children → Huly
3. Adding child to existing parent
4. Removing child from parent
5. Deleting parent (what happens to children?)
6. Re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
7. Circular reference prevention
8. Deep nesting (grandchildren)

## Deliverables

- Unit tests for parent-child mapping functions
- Integration tests for sync scenarios

Huly Issue: HVSYN-197

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

---

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

---

title: Fix Beads sync duplicate issue creation
[Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Already Existed

title: Research Beads metadata/tag capabilities for status storage

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Investigate how Beads stores and exposes metadata/tags to determine the best approach for storing full Huly status.

## Research Questions

1. **Metadata storage**: Does Beads support arbitrary key-value metadata on issues?
2. **Tag support**: Can we use tags like  to track status?
3. **CLI access**: How do we read/write metadata via the Issues chained together like beads. A lightweight issue tracker with first-class dependency support.

Usage:
  bd [flags]
  bd [command]

Maintenance:
  rename-prefix      Rename the issue prefix for all issues in the database

Integrations & Advanced:
Working With Issues:
  close              Close one or more issues
  comment            Add a comment to an issue (alias for 'comments add')
  comments           View or manage comments on an issue
  create             Create a new issue (or multiple issues from markdown file)
  create-form        Create a new issue using an interactive form
  delete             Delete one or more issues and clean up references
  edit               Edit an issue field in $EDITOR
  label              Manage issue labels
  list               List issues
  pin                Attach a mol to an agent's hook (work assignment)
  q                  Quick capture: create issue and output only ID
  reopen             Reopen one or more closed issues
  search             Search issues by text query
  show               Show issue details
  unpin              Unpin one or more issues
  update             Update one or more issues

Views & Reports:
  activity           Show real-time molecule state feed
  count              Count issues matching filters
  stale              Show stale issues (not updated recently)
  status             Show issue database overview and statistics

Dependencies & Structure:
  dep                Manage dependencies
  duplicate          Mark an issue as a duplicate of another
  duplicates         Find and optionally merge duplicate issues
  epic               Epic management commands
  graph              Display issue dependency graph
  relate             Create a bidirectional relates_to link between issues
  supersede          Mark an issue as superseded by a newer one
  unrelate           Remove a relates_to link between issues

Sync & Data:
  daemon             Manage background sync daemon
  daemons            Manage multiple bd daemons
  export             Export issues to JSONL format
  import             Import issues from JSONL format
  merge              Git merge driver for beads JSONL files
  restore            Restore full history of a compacted issue from git
  sync               Synchronize issues with git remote

Setup & Configuration:
  config             Manage configuration settings
  hooks              Manage git hooks for bd auto-sync
  info               Show database and daemon information
  init               Initialize bd in the current directory
  onboard            Display minimal snippet for AGENTS.md
  prime              Output AI-optimized workflow context
  quickstart         Quick start guide for bd
  setup              Setup integration with AI editors

Maintenance:
  cleanup            Delete closed issues and prune expired tombstones
  detect-pollution   Detect and optionally clean test issues from database
  doctor             Check and fix beads installation health (start here)
  migrate            Migrate database to current version
  migrate-hash-ids   Migrate sequential IDs to hash-based IDs (legacy)
  migrate-issues     Move issues between repositories
  migrate-sync       Migrate to sync.branch workflow for multi-clone setups
  migrate-tombstones Convert deletions.jsonl entries to inline tombstones
  upgrade            Check and manage bd version upgrades

Integrations & Advanced:
  jira               Jira integration commands
  linear             Linear integration commands
  repo               Manage multiple repository configuration
  reset              Remove all beads data and configuration

Additional Commands:
  audit              Record and label agent interactions (append-only JSONL)
  blocked            Show blocked issues
  compact            Compact old closed issues to save space
  completion         Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
  cook               Compile a formula into a proto (ephemeral by default)
  defer              Defer one or more issues for later
  formula            Manage workflow formulas
  gate               Gate commands (async coordination)
  help               Help about any command
  hook               Inspect what's on an agent's hook
  mail               Delegate to mail provider (e.g., gt mail)
  mol                Molecule commands (work templates)
  pour               Instantiate a proto as a persistent mol (solid -> liquid)
  ready              Show ready work (no blockers, open or in_progress)
  ship               Publish a capability for cross-project dependencies
  thanks             Thank the human contributors to beads
  undefer            Undefer one or more issues (restore to open)
  version            Print version information
  wisp               Manage ephemeral molecules (wisps)

Flags:
      --actor string            Actor name for audit trail (default: $BD_ACTOR or $USER)
      --allow-stale             Allow operations on potentially stale data (skip staleness check)
      --db string               Database path (default: auto-discover .beads/*.db)
  -h, --help                    help for bd
      --json                    Output in JSON format
      --lock-timeout duration   SQLite busy timeout (0 = fail immediately if locked) (default 30s)
      --no-auto-flush           Disable automatic JSONL sync after CRUD operations
      --no-auto-import          Disable automatic JSONL import when newer than DB
      --no-daemon               Force direct storage mode, bypass daemon if running
      --no-db                   Use no-db mode: load from JSONL, no SQLite
      --profile                 Generate CPU profile for performance analysis
  -q, --quiet                   Suppress non-essential output (errors only)
      --readonly                Read-only mode: block write operations (for worker sandboxes)
      --sandbox                 Sandbox mode: disables daemon and auto-sync
  -v, --verbose                 Enable verbose/debug output
  -V, --version                 Print version information

Use "bd [command] --help" for more information about a command. CLI?
4. **JSONL format**: How is metadata represented in the  export?
5. **Update mechanism**: Can we update metadata without changing the issue's ?

## Deliverables

- [ ] Document Beads metadata capabilities
- [ ] Recommend approach (metadata vs tags vs description field)
- [ ] Identify any limitations or edge cases
- [ ] Create proof-of-concept showing metadata round-trip

## Acceptance Criteria

- Clear recommendation on storage approach
- Working example of storing/retrieving custom status
- Documentation of CLI commands needed

title: Implement reparenting detection and sync
Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

Add status update command support for Beads CLI users

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Enable users to update the full Huly status directly from the Beads CLI, which will then sync back to Huly.

## Use Case

A developer working in their terminal wants to move a task to "In Review":


📊 Issue Database Status

Summary:
  Total Issues:           49
  Open:                   38
  In Progress:            0
  Blocked:                0
  Closed:                 11
  Ready to Work:          38

Extended:
  Deleted:                1 (tombstones)
  Avg Lead Time:          22.8 hours

Recent Activity (last 24 hours):
  Commits:                5
  Total Changes:          5
  Issues Created:         1
  Issues Closed:          2
  Issues Reopened:        0
  Issues Updated:         2

For more details, use 'bd list' to see individual issues.

## Implementation Options

### Option A: Custom bd command wrapper

Create a helper script that:

1. Updates the Beads metadata with the new status
2. Optionally closes/reopens the issue if status is Done/Canceled

### Option B: Direct metadata update

Document how users can update metadata directly:



### Option C: Sync service API endpoint

Add an endpoint to the sync service:

Not Found

## Deliverables

- [ ] Document recommended approach for CLI status updates
- [ ] Implement chosen solution
- [ ] Add examples to AGENTS.md
- [ ] Test status changes sync correctly to Huly

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Users can update full status from command line
- [ ] Status changes sync to Huly on next sync cycle
- [ ] Clear documentation for developers

Huly Issue: HVSYN-44

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: [BUG] Bidirectional sync creates duplicate issues - Huly issues not visible in Beads

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Problem When syncing bidirectionally between Beads and Huly, duplicate issues are being created. This indicates that Huly→Beads sync is failing to import existing issues, causing Beads to create new entries for work that already exists in Huly. ## Evidence

Beads Created

Already Existed

Title

Status

GRAPH-101

Done

Done

Done

GRAPH-128

GRAPH-107

[P3] Integrate publisher into Graphiti mutation paths

Done

## Root Cause Analysis Possible causes: 1. **Huly→Beads sync failure** - Original issues never made it to Beads, so Beads didn't know they existed 2. **Beads deduplication failure** - Beads received Huly issues but didn't recognize them when creating new tasks 3. **ID/linking mismatch** - Sync isn't maintaining proper cross-references between systems 4. **Timing issue** - Beads tasks created before Huly sync completed ## Expected Behavior - Issues created in Huly should appear in Beads via huly-vibe-sync-w3ds [P1] [task] open - title: Implement reparenting detection and sync
[Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via  field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have  field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint:  returns 
- Can set  when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with  pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with  set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need  and  columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

title: Implement webhook-based change detection from huly-change-watcher

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Overview

Replace polling-based sync with webhook notifications from huly-change-watcher service for real-time updates and reduced CPU usage.

## Implementation Complete

### Files Created/Modified:

1. **lib/HulyWebhookHandler.js** (NEW)
   - Manages webhook subscriptions with change watcher service
   - Processes incoming webhook payloads
   - Groups changes by project for efficient handling
   - Health checks and statistics tracking
   - Graceful degradation to polling if webhooks fail
2. **lib/ApiServer.js**
   - Added  endpoint to receive change notifications
   - Integrated webhookHandler parameter
   - Added webhook endpoints to availableEndpoints list
3. **index.js**
   - Initialize HulyWebhookHandler on startup
   - Subscribe to change watcher service
   - Handle webhook changes via onChangesReceived callback
   - Graceful fallback to polling if subscription fails
4. **docker-compose.yml**
   - Added HULY_CHANGE_WATCHER_URL environment variable
   - Added WEBHOOK_CALLBACK_URL environment variable

## Configuration



## Status: ✅ COMPLETE

- Successfully subscribed to change watcher service
- Webhook endpoint receiving notifications
- Real-time change detection operational
- Polling overhead eliminated

## Benefits

- **Eliminates polling overhead** - No more constant database queries
- **Real-time updates** - Changes pushed immediately when they occur
- **Reduced CPU usage** - Event-driven instead of polling every 5 seconds
- **Better scalability** - Multiple services can subscribe to same change stream
